CE 3372 Water Systems Design

Catalog Description

3372. Water Systems Design (3:3:0). Prerequisite: CE 3305, 3354. Hydraulic analysis and design of municipal water distribution, stormwater collection, and wastewater collection systems. Oral and written presentations. (Communication Intensive)

Pipeline Head Loss Models

Review of pipe head loss models.

Lesson Notes   Instructor notes used in face-to-face presentation.

Closed Conduit Flow  Roberson, J.A., Cassidy, J.J., and Chaudry, M.H. (1988) Closed Conduits in "Hydraulic Engineering." Houghton Mifflin Co. pp. 240-310

Closed Conduits  Chin, D. (2006). pp. 10-26 in "Water Resources Engineering, 2 ed." Prentice Hall, Inc.

Notes on Hydraulics   Work in progress -- largely replicates content in "Closed Condiut Flow" with some extensions

Water Distribution Systems  "Water Distribution Systems" in Land Development Handbook, Ed. S.O. Dewberry, Dewberry Inc., McGraw-Hill

Links to related videos

Lesson 4 Sec 001 (Evening)

Lesson 4 Sec 002 (Morning)

Hydraulic Analysis Example Using hydraulics principles and on-line toolkit to analyze a hypothetical water system (in Africa) to supply water from Lake Gulameta to a nearby school.

Hydraulic Analysis Example Using Hazen-Williams On-Line Calculator and hydraulic principles to find pump operating conditions.

Supplemental Data in Lecture Description of the data

Spreadsheets/Scripts Spreadsheets to compute flow between two reservoirs
